intro: Brachyscome linearis, commonly known as the slender everlasting daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of white, pink, and purple. The plant has linear, grass-like leaves and produces numerous small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils. Brachyscome linearis is also used in floral arrangements due to its long-lasting blooms.
